body: cc @icota
tACK https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/22076/commits/865627be85778799f86122653253c5448b5ef41a

Updated 865627be85778799f86122653253c5448b5ef41a -> db1bb18b87de92068689dbd4aa0c4c4f500ed9ab ([pr22076.01](https://github.com/hebasto/bitcoin/commits/pr22076.01) -> [pr22076.02](https://github.com/hebasto/bitcoin/commits/pr22076.02), [diff](https://github.com/hebasto/bitcoin/compare/pr22076.01..pr22076.02)):

- addressed @fanquake's [comment](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/22076#discussion_r642270347)

@icota @fanquake

Do you mind having another look into this pr?
This PR is life !

@BlockMechanic Maybe even larger than life :earth_africa: 

@hebasto I am running into this:
```
make[1]: Leaving directory '/home/igor/Code/bitcoin/src'
make -C .. bitcoin_qt_apk
make[1]: Entering directory '/home/igor/Code/bitcoin/src'
tar: ../depends/sources/qtbase-everywhere-src-5.12.11.tar.xz: Not found in archive
tar: Exiting with failure status due to previous errors
tar: ../depends/sources/qtbase-everywhere-src-5.12.11.tar.xz: Not found in archive
tar: Exiting with failure status due to previous errors
tar: ../depends/sources/qtbase-everywhere-src-5.12.11.tar.xz: Not found in archive
tar: Exiting with failure status due to previous errors
mkdir -p qt/android/libs/arm64-v8a
cp /home/igor/Code/bitcoin/depends/SDKs/android/ndk/21.1.6352462/toolchains/llvm/prebuilt/linux-x86_64/bin//../sysroot/usr/lib/aarch64-linux-android/libc++_shared.so qt/android/libs/arm64-v8a
tar xf ../depends/sources/qtbase-everywhere-src-5.12.10.tar.xz ../depends/sources/qtbase-everywhere-src-5.12.11.tar.xz -C qt/android/src/ src/android/jar/src --strip-components=5
tar: ../depends/sources/qtbase-everywhere-src-5.12.11.tar.xz: Not found in archive
tar: src/android/jar/src: Not found in archive
tar: Exiting with failure status due to previous errors
make[1]: *** [Makefile:18020: bitcoin_qt_apk] Error 2
make[1]: Leaving directory '/home/igor/Code/bitcoin/src'
make: *** [Makefile:11: apk] Error 2
```
`FILE_ENV="./ci/test/00_setup_env_android.sh" ./ci/test_run_all.sh`

@icota i got around that by changing 
https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/blob/master/src/Makefile.qt.include#L389


`QT_BASE_PATH = $(shell find ../depends/sources/ -maxdepth 1 -type f -regex ".*qtbase.*$(QT_BASE_VERSION)\.tar.xz")
`

to 

`QT_BASE_PATH = $(shell find $(top_srcdir)/depends/sources/ -maxdepth 1 -type f -regex ".*qtbase.*$(QT_BASE_VERSION)\.tar.xz")
`

@icota @BlockMechanic 

Do changes from #22555 fix an issue with `QT_BASE_PATH` here for you?

> Do changes from #22555 fix an issue with `QT_BASE_PATH` here for you?

They do. Is #22555 meant to be a replacement?

Also, on my system `FILE_ENV="./ci/test/00_setup_env_android.sh" ./ci/test_run_all.sh` passed.

@icota @BlockMechanic 
Mind having another round of reviewing please?

Updated 1de0b494b6e645956753e71731dba4dbc86215e6 -> 15fb57556ee9a5f7332c9fff61edc0cc67634053 ([pr22076.03](https://github.com/hebasto/bitcoin/commits/pr22076.03) -> [pr22076.04](https://github.com/hebasto/bitcoin/commits/pr22076.04)):

- addressed @fanquake's [comment](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/22076#discussion_r744339610)
Why is this needed?

To enable `ccache` the code below in `configure.ac` makes the `CC` variable looks like that
```
<path_to_ccache> <path_to_compiler>
```
Then https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/blob/5c041cb348e667672c8b5ed504dba05adf60783b/src/Makefile.qt.include#L390

the `make` function `$(dir $(CC))` treats the `CC` variable as a list of two paths, and, eventually, the `cp` command fails.

`CC_UNPREFIXED` always contains a path to a compiler only.
This could really use some sort of comment.
Thanks! [Updated](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/22076#issuecomment-853202108).

diff_hunk:
@@ -391,7 +391,7 @@ QT_BASE_TLD = $(shell tar tf $(QT_BASE_PATH) --exclude='*/*')
 
 bitcoin_qt_apk: FORCE
 	mkdir -p $(APK_LIB_DIR)
-	cp $(dir $(CC))../sysroot/usr/lib/$(host_alias)/libc++_shared.so $(APK_LIB_DIR)
+	cp $(dir $(CC_UNPREFIXED))../sysroot/usr/lib/$(host_alias)/libc++_shared.so $(APK_LIB_DIR)
body:
```suggestion
	cp $(dir $(lastword $(CC)))../sysroot/usr/lib/$(host_alias)/libc++_shared.so $(APK_LIB_DIR)
```

diff_hunk:
@@ -391,7 +391,7 @@ QT_BASE_TLD = $(shell tar tf $(QT_BASE_PATH) --exclude='*/*')
 
 bitcoin_qt_apk: FORCE
 	mkdir -p $(APK_LIB_DIR)
-	cp $(dir $(CC))../sysroot/usr/lib/$(host_alias)/libc++_shared.so $(APK_LIB_DIR)
+	cp $(dir $(CC_UNPREFIXED))../sysroot/usr/lib/$(host_alias)/libc++_shared.so $(APK_LIB_DIR)
body: Is it guaranteed that this approach will work for all cases of user-provided `CC`?

diff_hunk:
@@ -391,7 +391,7 @@ QT_BASE_TLD = $(shell tar tf $(QT_BASE_PATH) --exclude='*/*')
 
 bitcoin_qt_apk: FORCE
 	mkdir -p $(APK_LIB_DIR)
-	cp $(dir $(CC))../sysroot/usr/lib/$(host_alias)/libc++_shared.so $(APK_LIB_DIR)
+	cp $(dir $(CC_UNPREFIXED))../sysroot/usr/lib/$(host_alias)/libc++_shared.so $(APK_LIB_DIR)
body: Thanks! [Updated](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/22076#issuecomment-962824073).
